poem:
**The Stage's Quiet Rebirth**

Across continents,  
echoes of Ibsen stir—  
Wagner's voice,  
an eloquent thread  
through ancient wars'  
aftermath.  
Under European skies,  
a Brazilian heart beats,  
crafting new truths  
from old fabric,  
each festival a hearth  
where stories burn anew,  
murmuring dreams,  
woven in silence,  
the timeless whisper  
of shared humanity.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Wagner Moura to lead Ibsen update in unique European festival collaboration The award-winning Brazilian actor Wagner Moura is to star in a new play being staged at three European festivals next year, in the first joint production since their foundation two years after the second world war. Moura, who is being tipped for an Oscar nomination for the Secret Agent, will take the lead role in a new production updating the Henrik Ibsen play An". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
